title: Test Poem
author: Test Author
lines: Is the poem fetched or lost in code,
Did the API yield what it showed?
In JSON fields, the words await,
But syntax errors tempt their fate.
With async dreams, we call once more,
Debugging logs, the endless chore.
Oh fetch, succeedâ€”let poems flow,
So all my testing woes can go.

title: To Mr Thomas Southern, on His Birthday, 1742.
author: Alexander Pope
lines: Resign'd to live, prepared to die,
With not one sin, but poetry,
This day Tom's fair account has run
(Without a blot) to eighty-one.
Kind Boyle, before his poet lays
A table, with a cloth of bays;
And Ireland, mother of sweet singers,
Presents her harp still to his fingers.
The feast, his towering genius marks
In yonder wild goose and the larks;
The mushrooms show his wit was sudden;
And for his judgment, lo, a pudden!
Roast beef, though old, proclaims him stout,
And grace, although a bard, devout.
May Tom, whom Heaven sent down to raise
The price of prologues and of plays,
Be every birthday more a winner,
Digest his thirty-thousandth dinner;
Walk to his grave without reproach,
And scorn a rascal and a coach.
